member.name: P:MVCGrid.Interfaces.IMVCGridColumn.HeaderText
member.summary: Header text to display for the current column, if different from ColumnName.

member.summary: A unique name for this column

member.summary: Enables sorting on this column

member.name: P:MVCGrid.Interfaces.IMVCGridColumn.HtmlEncode
member.summary: Disables html encoding on the data for the current cell. Turn this off if your ValueExpression or ValueTemplate returns HTML.

member.summary: Enables filtering on this column

member.summary: Indicates whether column is visible.

member.name: P:MVCGrid.Interfaces.IMVCGridColumn.SortColumnData
member.summary: Object to pass to QueryOptions when this column is sorted on. Only specify if different from ColumnName

member.name: P:MVCGrid.Interfaces.IMVCGridColumn.AllowChangeVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column visibility can be changed.

member.name: M:MVCGrid.Models.MVCGridBuilder`1.WithRetrieveDataMethod(System.Func{MVCGrid.Models.GridContext,MVCGrid.Models.QueryResult{`0}})
member.summary: This is the method that will actually query the data to populate the grid. Use entity framework, a module from you IoC container, direct SQL queries, etc. to get the data. Inside the providee GridContext there is a QueryOptions object which will be populated with the currently requested sorting, paging, and filtering options which you must take into account. See the QueryOptions documentation below. You must return a QueryResult object which takes an enumerable of your type and a count of the total number of records which must be provided if paging is enabled.

member.name: M:MVCGrid.Models.MVCGridBuilder`1.WithRowCssClassExpression(System.Func{`0,MVCGrid.Models.GridContext,System.String})
member.summary: Use this to specify a custom css class based on data for the current row

member.summary: Use this to specify a custom css class based on data for the current row

member.summary: Enables sorting on the grid. Note, sorting must also be enabled on each column where sorting is wanted

member.summary: Enables sorting on the grid. Note, sorting must also be enabled on each column where sorting is wanted

member.summary: Remove an additional setting

member.summary: The rendering mode to use for this grid. By default it will use the RenderingEngine rendering mode. If you want to use a custom Razor view to display your grid, change this to Controller

member.name: M:MVCGrid.Models.MVCGridBuilder`1.WithSummaryMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Summary text to display in grid footer. Defaults to "Showing {0} to {1} of {2} entries" {0} = first record number shown on page {1} = last record number shown on page {2} = total number of records on all pages

member.name: P:MVCGrid.Models.GridDefinition`1.RetrieveData
member.summary: This is the method that will actually query the data to populate the grid. Use entity framework, a module from you IoC container, direct SQL queries, etc. to get the data. Inside the providee GridContext there is a QueryOptions object which will be populated with the currently requested sorting, paging, and filtering options which you must take into account. See the QueryOptions documentation below. You must return a QueryResult object which takes an enumerable of your type and a count of the total number of records which must be provided if paging is enabled.

member.summary: Use this to specify a custom css class based on data for the current row
